intro: Coussarea speciosa, commonly known as the golden torch or flame tree, is a striking tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range from yellow to orange-red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a velvety texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
